fields.Title: Instructor's Manual to Accompany The Curious Writer, 4th ed
fields.Description/Abstract:
About This Product
DESCRIPTION
Written by Bruce Ballenger’s long-time collaborator and colleague Michelle Payne, the Instructor’s Manual is informed by years of experience mentoring first-year TAs and novice teachers using The Curious Writer.
The Manual begins with strategies for organizing a course, focused on the “big picture” provided by the inquiry strategy of The Curious Writer.
For each chapter of The Curious Writer, the Manual includes:
Overview: Goals and Principles to Emphasize. Key concepts for each chapter and the learning outcomes it covers.
Discussion Starters: How to Talk about the Chapters. Pre-reading activities that can be assigned to students before they read the chapter.
Assignment Design: Suggestions for Designing the Essay Assignment. Additional suggestions on each writing and inquiry project in the book, along with suggestions for anticipating student challenges with each type of project.
Discussing the Readings: Summary and Teaching Activities. Summaries of each reading in a chapter, and up to three additional writing activities to use with each reading.
Additional Writing Activities. A large number of writing activities and in-class activities that can be used to supplement each chapter.
Writing Projects. Projects students might do, including group projects, as alternatives to the projects offered in the textbook.
Additional Resources: Readings and Web Links. An annotated bibliography of general resources on teaching writing, multimodal composition, and inquiry; useful for training seminars for teaching assistants.
Course Handouts. Assignment sheets for projects in the textbook that can be copied or handed out in class.
